messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Range 1 to 5 Unit Level
    Air Quality
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power [POWER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          On [1]
    SetFanSpeed [SETFANSPEED]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit Level
    ResetFilter [RESETFILTER]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to 3?

First, I look at the device properties and commands. The Power property can be Off (0) or On (1), and the fan speed ranges from 1 to 5 levels. The commands to control these are Power with parameter 0 or 1, and SetFanSpeed with a parameter from 1 to 5.

To turn on the purifier, send the Power command with parameter 1. To set the fan speed to 3, send SetFanSpeed with parameter 3.

Result: Execute Power(1) to turn on the purifier, then SetFanSpeed(3) to set fan speed to level 3.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Range 1 to 5 Unit Level
    Air Quality
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power [POWER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          On [1]
    SetFanSpeed [SETFANSPEED]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit Level
    ResetFilter [RESETFILTER]

USER QUERY:
What is the current air quality reading and how much filter life is left?

The device has properties Air Quality (0-500 AQI) and Filter Life (0-100%). These represent the current air pollution level and remaining filter usability.

Since the user asks for current readings, I would retrieve the Air Quality and Filter Life property values.

Result: The air quality is reported as the current AQI value (0-500), and the filter life shows the remaining percentage (0-100%). Please check the device status to get these exact numbers.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Range 1 to 5 Unit Level
    Air Quality
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power [POWER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          On [1]
    SetFanSpeed [SETFANSPEED]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit Level
    ResetFilter [RESETFILTER]

USER QUERY:
I just replaced the filter. How do I reset the filter life indicator?

The device accepts a ResetFilter command without parameters to reset the filter life indicator.

Since the user replaced the filter, sending ResetFilter will reset the Filter Life property back to 100% or its initial state.

Result: Execute the ResetFilter command to reset the filter life indicator after replacement.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Range 1 to 5 Unit Level
    Air Quality
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
    Filter Life
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power [POWER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          On [1]
    SetFanSpeed [SETFANSPEED]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit Level
    ResetFilter [RESETFILTER]

USER QUERY:
Please turn off the purifier and confirm its power status.

The Power property indicates if the purifier is On (1) or Off (0). To turn it off, send the Power command with parameter 0.

After sending the command, the device's Power property should reflect Off (0).

Result: Send Power(0) to turn off the purifier. Confirm the Power property is 0 indicating it is off.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Humidity
      Range 10 to 90 Unit %
    Mode
      Range 0 to 3 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    setTemperature [SETTEMPERATURE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    setMode [SETMODE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 3 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    setHumidityTarget [SETHUMIDITYTARGET]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10 to 90 Unit %

USER QUERY:
How do I set the thermostat to cool mode and target a temperature of 22.5 degrees Celsius?

The device supports modes Off (0), Heat (1), Cool (2), and Auto (3). The setMode command accepts these indices. Temperature can be set between 10.0 and 30.0 °C using setTemperature.

To set cool mode, send setMode with parameter 2. To set temperature to 22.5 °C, send setTemperature with 22.5.

Result: Execute setMode(2) to switch to cool mode, then setTemperature(22.5) to set the target temperature.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Humidity
      Range 10 to 90 Unit %
    Mode
      Range 0 to 3 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    setTemperature [SETTEMPERATURE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    setMode [SETMODE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 3 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    setHumidityTarget [SETHUMIDITYTARGET]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10 to 90 Unit %

USER QUERY:
What is the current humidity and can I set a target humidity of 45%?

The device has a Humidity property ranging from 10 to 90%. The accepted command setHumidityTarget allows setting a target humidity within this range.

To answer, first retrieve the current Humidity property value. Then, since 45% is within the allowed range, send setHumidityTarget with parameter 45 to set the target humidity.

Result: The current humidity is the device's Humidity property value. To set target humidity, execute setHumidityTarget(45).
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Humidity
      Range 10 to 90 Unit %
    Mode
      Range 0 to 3 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    setTemperature [SETTEMPERATURE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    setMode [SETMODE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 3 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    setHumidityTarget [SETHUMIDITYTARGET]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10 to 90 Unit %

USER QUERY:
Turn off the thermostat and confirm its mode.

The Mode property has Off (0), Heat (1), Cool (2), and Auto (3). To turn off the thermostat, send setMode with parameter 0.

After sending the command, the Mode property should be 0 indicating Off.

Result: Execute setMode(0) to turn off the thermostat and confirm Mode property is 0.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Light Bulb
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color
      Range 0 to 4 Unit Index
        Red [0]
        Green [1]
        Blue [2]
        White [3]
        Warm White [4]
    Power
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    setBrightness [SETBRIGHTNESS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    setColor [SETCOLOR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 4 Unit Index
          Red [0]
          Green [1]
          Blue [2]
          White [3]
          Warm White [4]
    setPower [SETPOWER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          On [1]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the living room light to warm white and 75% brightness?

The device supports colors Red (0), Green (1), Blue (2), White (3), and Warm White (4). Brightness ranges from 0 to 100%.

To set the light to warm white, send setColor with parameter 4. To set brightness to 75%, send setBrightness with parameter 75.

Result: Execute setColor(4) to set warm white color, then setBrightness(75) to set brightness to 75%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Light Bulb
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color
      Range 0 to 4 Unit Index
        Red [0]
        Green [1]
        Blue [2]
        White [3]
        Warm White [4]
    Power
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    setBrightness [SETBRIGHTNESS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    setColor [SETCOLOR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 4 Unit Index
          Red [0]
          Green [1]
          Blue [2]
          White [3]
          Warm White [4]
    setPower [SETPOWER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          On [1]

USER QUERY:
Is the bedroom light currently on, and what is its brightness level?

The Power property indicates if the light is On (1) or Off (0). Brightness is from 0 to 100%.

To answer, check the Power property: if 1, the light is on; if 0, it is off. Then read the Brightness property for the current brightness level.

Result: The bedroom light is on if Power=1, off if Power=0. Its brightness is the current Brightness property value in percent.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Light Bulb
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color
      Range 0 to 4 Unit Index
        Red [0]
        Green [1]
        Blue [2]
        White [3]
        Warm White [4]
    Power
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    setBrightness [SETBRIGHTNESS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    setColor [SETCOLOR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 4 Unit Index
          Red [0]
          Green [1]
          Blue [2]
          White [3]
          Warm White [4]
    setPower [SETPOWER]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          Off [0]
          On [1]

USER QUERY:
Please turn off the kitchen light.

The Power property controls whether the light is On (1) or Off (0). To turn off the kitchen light, send setPower command with parameter 0.

Result: Execute setPower(0) to turn off the kitchen light.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***
Name: AudioPlayer

      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Speaker Jack [0]
        Bluetooth [1]
    Volume
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Shuffle
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        No [0]
        Yes [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Play [PLAY]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit Index
          None [0]
          Religious [1]
          Sky and Sabzi [2]
          Farsi [3]
          Uncle Nader [4]
          Classical [5]
          Vocal [6]
          Opera [7]

          Favorites [17]
          Euro [18]
          Maman [19]
    Shuffle [SHUFFLE]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          No [0]
          Yes [1]
    Previous [PREVIOUS]
    Stop [STOP]
    Next [NEXT]
    Output [OUTPUT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
          Speaker Jack [0]
          Bluetooth [1]
    Volume [VOLUME]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %

USER QUERY:
Can you play the classical playlist and set the volume to 60%?

The device supports playing playlists indexed 0 to 100, with Classical at index 5. Volume ranges from 0 to 100%.

To play the classical playlist, send Play command with parameter 5. To set volume to 60%, send Volume command with parameter 60.

Result: Execute Play(5) to start the classical playlist, then Volume(60) to set volume to 60%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Is Bluetooth enabled and can you switch the output to Bluetooth?

The Bluetooth property indicates if Bluetooth is Disabled (0) or Enabled (1). The Output property can be Speaker Jack (0) or Bluetooth (1).

To check if Bluetooth is enabled, read the Bluetooth property. To switch output to Bluetooth, send Output command with parameter 1.

Result: Bluetooth is enabled if Bluetooth property=1. To switch output, execute Output(1) to select Bluetooth output.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Please enable shuffle mode and increase the volume to 80%.

The Shuffle property can be No (0) or Yes (1). The Volume property ranges from 0 to 100%.

To enable shuffle, send Shuffle command with parameter 1. To set volume to 80%, send Volume command with parameter 80.

Result: Execute Shuffle(1) to enable shuffle mode, then Volume(80) to set volume to 80%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Stop the music and set output to speaker jack.

The Stop command requires no parameters and stops playback. The Output command accepts parameter 0 for Speaker Jack and 1 for Bluetooth.

To stop music, send Stop command. To set output to speaker jack, send Output command with parameter 0.

Result: Execute Stop() to stop music, then Output(0) to set output to speaker jack.
